result.execSummary:
The defendant Davarious K Norwood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: with 4 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence/count. First 6 months straight time, remainder can be with Huber release.

miscConds.notes:
EACH COUNT:  Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Cash bail on deposit to be applied.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs. Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: With Huber and Day Reporting Center.  Court stayed commencement until 10/23/2015 by 5pm.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: With 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence/count.  First 6 months straight time, remainder can be with Huber release.
*11/4/2015  probation term commuted to one year.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Davarious K Norwood

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: printed in error.  No changes.
Count two per Order signed on 11/4/2015
Order Commuting Term of Probation on Count 2 and Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and Dept of Corrections.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  jbs
Letter from DOC seeking amended judgment of conviction on probationary term.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 4 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence/count.  First 6 months straight time, remainder can be with Huber release.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence/count.  First 6 months straight time, remainder can be with Huber release.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- 4 MONTHS condition time with Huber and Day Reporting Center.  Court stayed commencement until 10/23/2015 by 5pm.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Cash bail on deposit to be applied.

Filed:  
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Sentencing Referral Form

As to Amended Counts 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Davarious K Norwood in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered Count 1 amended to Possession with Intent to Deliver Controlled Substance (THC), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 9413.41(1m)(h)1, 939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony.
Count 2 added- Possession of Cocaine, contrary to Wisconsin section 964.41(3g)(c), a class an unclassified Misdemeanor.

Defendant Davarious K Norwood in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Davarious K Norwood in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court grants defendant's request for substitution of attorney Toran for attorney Carpenter.
Jury trial of 08/17/2015 is vacated.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Davarious K Norwood in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Davarious K Norwood in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter. Nick Cerwin for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 8/4/2015 at 1:30 pm and JURY TRIAL on 8/17/2015 at 9:00 am. Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed. Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Davarious K Norwood in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  David John Behm for Marissa Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Court in trial.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 15.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Davarious K Norwood in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference conducted.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Davarious K Norwood in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  JoAnn Hardtke for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM011361  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02/27/2015
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-10-2015 at 08:30 am.

As an addtional condition of bail:
No drugs without a valid prescription
No weapons

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Davarious K Norwood in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Ann R. López appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-041

Parties in court for initial appearance.  Defense counsel motion to dismiss due to lack of probable cause denied by the Court.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. 
Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/2/15 @ 1:30 pm
